Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cliotide T10 (CT10; Cter B; natural AMPs; cyclotides; XXC; 3S=S, UCBB1ab; Fabaceae, plants)

Literature Information.Literature: MIC against E.coli (MIC>160 uM), P. aeruginosa (20 uM), S.aureus (>160 uM), and C.albicans (>160 uM) (Strömstedt AA et al., 2017). Active against Human non-small lung cancer cells A549. MIC against  P. aeruginosa (20 uM). It is found that a phospholipid-specific mechanism of membrane permeabilization, through interaction with phosphatidylethanolamine-lipids, is essential for cyclotides active primarily on Gram-negative bacteria (Strömstedt AA et al., 2017). 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Nguyen GK, Zhang S, Nguyen NT, Nguyen PQ, Chiu MS, Hardjojo A, Tam JP.2011
Literature Information.Title: Discovery and characterization of novel cyclotides originated from chimeric precursors consisting of albumin-1 chain a and cyclotide domains in the fabaceae family
